business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open in red dragged by decline in IT and energy stocks The S&P BSE Sensex was down 420.71 points to 77,159.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 132.50 points to 23,400.25.

Final day to buy MRF shares for dividend eligibility ahead of ex-dividend dateThe board of MRF, in its recent meeting, announced the interim dividend while also releasing its financial results for the second quarter that ended on September 30, 2024.
Trading setup for today: What to expect from the stock markets? Last week marked the second consecutive week of losses, as both the Sensex and Nifty declined by nearly 2%.

RIL, Ola Electric, Adani Green, Hero Motocorp: Stocks to watch today Several key stocks, including Hero MotoCorp, Grasim Industries, Adani Green Energy, and Ola Electric, are expected to remain in focus due to second-quarter earnings reports and other updates

Explained: Why Gold has become cheaper in India than in Gulf and SingaporeGold prices in India have become cheaper than in some traditional gold-buying destinations, like the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Oman, and Singapore.

Why are foreign investors exiting India? 3 reasons behind stock market selloffExperts suggest that the trajectory of future FPI flows will largely depend on how India maintains macroeconomic stability and improves corporate earnings.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Check key dates, price band, and latest GMPNTPC Green Energy IPO: The IPO is positioned as one of the largest in India this year, alongside Hyundai Motor India Ltd. and Swiggy Ltd. The anchor book will open for subscription on Monday.
Gold rates see biggest weekly drop in 3 years. Good time to buy?Despite the fall in prices, analysts remain bullish about the yellow metal's long-term potential. Here is all you need to know.

Is the IPO craze over? Stock market correction hits public listingsSubscription figures for IPOs have dropped in recent months. Global economic uncertainty, rising interest rates, and tighter liquidity have made investors cautious.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingNTPC Green Energy is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTPC Ltd, focusing on renewable energy projects through both organic growth and acquisitions.
I don't believe in work-life balance: Narayana MurthyNarayana Murthy said that hard work is key to national progress, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's long work hours as an example.

Rs 1 lakh investment now worth Rs 8 lakh: Check this LIC-backed penny stockATV Projects India has shown remarkable growth over recent years, making it one of the standout multibagger stocks in the Indian market. Since the start of 2024, the stock has risen by over 110%, moving from Rs 15.25 to Rs 32.50 per share.

Stock markets in free fall: Is it a good time to invest in mutual funds?With the Sensex and Nifty tumbling nearly 10% from their peaks, investors are wondering: Could this market correction be a blessing in disguise for mutual fund investors?

Stock markets in correction phase: More turbulence ahead on Dalal Street?The Sensex and Nifty have tumbled nearly 10% from their recent peaks, leaving investors wondering: Is this just a healthy pause, or should they brace for more turbulence?

SBI hikes home loan interest rates by 5 basis points. Check details  The change in interest rates is effective from November 15, and will make borrowing costs slightly higher for customers seeking loans from the State Bank of India (SBI).

Signature Global shares at over Rs 2,000? These 2 brokerages are bullishShares of Signature Global rose nearly 3.5% in the previous trading session after multiple brokerages raised their target price. Its total market capitalisation stands at 18,238.99 crore.
Piyush Goyal wants RBI to cut interest rates. Shaktikanta Das respondsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal described the link between food inflation and interest rates as an 'absolutely flawed theory.'

I'll take this with me to grave: Narayana Murthy defends 6-day workweek viewNarayana Murthy, who has been vocal about his views on work ethics and productivity, expressed disappointment over India's move from a six-day workweek to a five-day one in 1986.

'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Report flags Starlink's US military tiesStarlink operates through a constellation of satellites to provide internet access worldwide, a model distinct from traditional telecom services that rely on ground-based towers.

Stock markets closed today for Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday?Sensex and Nifty, have faced a six-session losing streak, marked by selling pressure from foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and worries over rising retail inflation.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Delhi air quality at season's worst, thick fog delays flights, schools go onlineDense fog reduced visibility in Delhi and disrupted flight operations, prompting airlines IndiGo and SpiceJet to issue travel advisories. As AQI spiked to 'severe plus' category, classes up to Grade 9 switched online, and strict anti-pollution curbs were enforced.

Narendra Modi the exception amid global anti-incumbency wave: Fareed ZakariaVeteran journalist and geopolitical analyst Fareed Zakaria credited PM Modi's enduring popularity and strategic political approach for defying the anti-incumbency trend sweeping democracies worldwide.

Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus calls attacks on Hindus 'exaggerated propaganda'Bangladesh Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus downplayed the violence against minority Hindus in the country after weeks of protests by Hindus demanding protection after a wave of attacks.

PM Modi arrives in Brazil for G20 Summit, says looks ahead to productive talks Prime Minister Narendra Modi said he is looking ahead to meaningful discussions at the Rio de Janeiro G20 Summit, which will also be attended by US President Joe Biden, Chinese President Xi Jinping, and other global leaders.

Trudeau admits Canada's immigration missteps: Could've turned off the taps fasterTrudeau said Canada ramped up immigration to bolster the labour market after the Covid-19 pandemic and to stave off a recession. However, some "bad actors" manipulated these schemes for profit, he claimed.

Delhi-NCR under GRAP-IV: What is banned amid worsening air quality levelsWith deteriorating air quality, authorities have imposed stringent anti-pollution measures under Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) to curb the devolving crisis.

Rohit and Gill out, Bumrah to lead? India face selection headache for Perth TestBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Jasprit Bumrah is likely to lead India in the first Test with Rohit Sharma set to miss the Perth opener, which starts on November 22 at the Optus Stadium. India are now set to begin the Test series without two members of their first-choice top three, with No. 3 Shubman Gill also out due to a thumb injury.

Uddhav Thackeray has Congress's votebank, Sena voters with us: Eknath ShindeSpeaking to India Today TV, Eknath Shinde launched a scathing attack on Uddhav Thackeray, accusing the former Chief Minister of banking on Congress's vote bank in the Maharashtra Assembly elections.
Video: Sanskrit chants welcome PM in Brazil as he arrives for G20 SummitPM Modi received a warm and spiritual welcome upon his arrival in Brazil. He was greeted with Sanskrit chants.
Harnessing the Power of Data: IIM Kozhikode's Professional Certificate Programme in Advanced Data Analytics for ManagersEmpowering Managers with Data-Driven Insights for Strategic Decision-Making

Robert F Kennedy Jr, who called Trump's fast food 'poison', enjoys it with himIn a picture shared by Donald Trump Jr on X, which also featured Elon Musk, Trump, and US House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson, Kennedy Jr can be seen holding a McDonald's burger, with a bottle of Coca-Cola placed nearby.

Supreme Court hearing on Delhi pollution today as air quality dips to worstThe Supreme Court agreed for an urgent hearing of a plea on Monday seeking directions to curb air pollution in the national capital and adjoining areas.

Diljit Dosanjh welcomes Kartik Aaryan as surprise guest at Ahmedabad concertActor Kartik Aaryan was the surprise guest at Diljit Dosanjh's Ahmedabad concert, held on November 17. The Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 actor shared a series of pictures with the musician on his Instagram page.

Jhansi hospital fire: Nurse braving burns, flames saves dozen babiesNurse Megha James who suffered burns while saving over a dozen babies is undergoing treatment for her injuries in the Jhansi medical hospital.

Sudha Murty's praise for son-in-law Rishi Sunak: Proud Brit with Indian valuesAuthor and Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murty heaped praise on son-in-law and former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak at Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan's annual Diwali gala in London.

Allu Arjun 'bows down' to the Bihar crowd at Pushpa 2 event: Jhukega nahi par...Actor Allu Arjun seemed overwhelmed by the turnout at the trailer launch event of Pushpa 2: The Rule in Patna. He thanked the people of Bihar in his speech, and bowed down to them on stage.

Jannik Sinner caps golden year by beating Taylor Fritz to ATP Finals gloryWorld number one and home favourite Jannik Sinner made history on Sunday, becoming the first Italian to win the ATP Finals title with a commanding 6-4, 6-4 victory over American Taylor Fritz.

G20 nations reach climate finance breakthrough that eluded COP29 talks: ReportHeads of state arrived in Rio de Janeiro on Sunday for the G20 summit and will spend Monday and Tuesday addressing issues from poverty and hunger to the reform of global institutions.

Amit Shah reviews Manipur security, key meeting today at 12 pm: SourcesA curfew was imposed in Imphal West and East after six people from Meitei groups, who were allegedly kidnapped by militants, were found dead. Internet was suspended in several districts as mobs attacked the homes of MLAs and also indulged in vandalism.

RFK Jr, now Trump's health czar, once claimed he got brainworm after India visitThis claim, which Kennedy first disclosed during a 2012 deposition and later elaborated on in interviews, has resurfaced online following his appointment as the secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) by Donald Trump.

Biden allows Ukraine to strike Russia with long-range US missilesThe decision allowing Kyiv to use the Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMs) for attacks farther inside Russia comes as President Vladimir Putin positions North Korean troops along Ukraine's northern border.

Jharkhand BJP asked to remove 'malicious' post, explain poll code breach by panelThe Congress and JMM condemned the video as "misleading and divisive", claiming it spread baseless allegations and incited hatred and enmity to influence voters.

100 days since RG Kar rape-murder, victim's parents flag off rally in KolkataParents of a 31-year-old trainee doctor, raped and murdered in Kolkata in August, flagged off a cycle rally with 200 participants, demanding justice and marking over 100 days since the crime.

Priyanka Chopra shares behind-the-scenes pics from Gunday: Most fun cast and crewPriyanka Chopra was going through her phone, when she stumbled across some photos clicked while shooting Gunday. It not just features her costumes from the song Jiyaa, but also the fun times she had while shooting the film. Do not miss Ranveer Singh's goofy photo.

Amaran box office Day 18: Sivakarthikeyan film rakes in Rs 189 crore globallySivakarthikeyan and Sai Pallavi-starrer Amaran earned Rs 189 crore nett in India in 18 days. The biographical film is based on the life of Major Mukund Varadarajan who was killed in the line of duty in 2014.

Zoya Akhtar shares photo of 'bestie girls' Suhana, Ananya, Shanaya and NavyaSuhana Khan, Ananya Panday, Shanaya Kapoor, and Navya Naveli Nanda were seen together, sparking rumours of a potential film collaboration with filmmaker Zoya Akhtar, who shared the moment on social media.

Kanguva box office Day 4: Suriya-starrer marching towards Rs 150 crore worldwideSuriya's latest outing, Kanguva, is now inching towards Rs 150 crore worldwide. The film, directed by Siruthai Siva, had a slow start at the box office.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli always steps up in Australia: Warner 'worried' ahead of Perth TestBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Former Australian opener David Warner has warned the Pat Cummins-led side about the threat posed by Virat Kohli, despite his recent slump in form. Warner believes Kohli's history of excelling in Australia could be pivotal in the upcoming five-match series.

Border-Gavaskar Trophy will test Gambhir's anger and patience: HarbhajanBorder-Gavaskar Trophy will Test head coach Gautam Gambhir's patience and anger, feels Harbhajan Singh. Coach Gambhir was put under the pump by the Indian media after he lost home series against New Zealand at home.

Slovakia reach Billie Jean King Cup semis after knocking out AustraliaSlovakia secured a spot in the Billie Jean King Cup semi-finals for the first time in over two decades, clinching a decisive 2-0 victory against Australia on Sunday. This marks Slovakia's first semi-final appearance since 2002.

My biggest support system: Suryakumar wishes wife Devisha on birthdaySuryakumar Yadav wished his wife Devisha Shetty on her birthday. Suryakumar recently had a great time in South Africa after winning the four-match T20I series 3-1.

Kapil Dev's message to India ahead of Australia Tests: Just shut out the noise Kapil Dev extended his best wishes to the Indian team ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy series. The 1st Test match will take place on November 22 in Perth.

PCB dismisses rumours of sacking Gillespie as Pakistan head coach Pakistan Cricket Board dismissed the reports of Aqib Javed replacing Jason Gillespie as the head coach of the national team across formats. Gillespie will stay the red-ball coach for the series against South Africa.

Taylor Fritz wary of Jannik Sinner challenge in US Open final rematchATP Finals 2024: Taylor Fritz is wary of the challenge that Jannik Sinner could pose to him in the all-important final in Turin. Sinner has beaten Fritz in their last three meetings.

Aaqib Javed set to replace Jason Gillespie as Pakistan white-ball teams' coachJason Gillespie is expected to be replaced as Pakistan's head coach across formats by Aaqib Javed. Gillespie is Pakistan's Test coach and currently the temporary coach of the white-ball side.

Harshit, Prasidh vie for 3rd pacer's slot in Perth Test, Shami to play in SMATHarshit Rana's raw pace and Prasidh Krishna's experience set up a fierce contest for India's third pacer's spot in the Perth Test. Meanwhile, Mohammed Shami will feature in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy as he eyes a Border-Gavaskar return.

Indian football team needs to improve in everything to beat Malaysia: Coach ManoloThe Indian football team is set to face Malaysia in their final match of the year, with coach Marquez Manolo emphasising the need for overall improvement as they aim to break a winless streak stretching across 11 games in 2023.

Shamsi highlighted this quirky stat on X, calling it a "crazy coincidence" that surprised cricket fans.

Prithvi Shaw returns for Mumbai in SMAT, Shreyas Iyer named captainSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy: Prithvi Shaw has returned to play for Mumbai and has been picked in the 17-member squad for the tournament. Shreyas Iyer has been appointed as the skipper.

Sunil Gavaskar predicts Shreyas Iyer's new IPL team ahead of mega auctionSunil Gavaskar predicts Shreyas Iyer's new team ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction. Iyer has set his base price at Rs 2 crore after being released by Kolkata Knight Riders.

18-year-old Lucy Hamilton becomes youngest to take 5-wicket haul in WBBLWBBL 2023-24: Brisbane Heat's Lucy Hamilton picked up a five-wicket haul in a record-breaking spell in the clash against Melbourne Stars on Sunday at the Drummoyne Oval in Sydney.

Never write off champions: Virat Kohli backed to regain form by Justin LangerFormer Australia coach Justin Langer has expressed confidence in Virat Kohli's ability to bounce back during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Despite recent struggles, Langer believes Kohli's performance in Australia will be crucial.

Rafael Nadal may skip singles action in Davis Cup farewell if it helps SpainRafael Nadal announced that he might forgo singles matches at this week's Davis Cup Finals in Málaga, focusing solely on doubles if it boosts Spain's chances of securing the title in his final tournament as a professional player.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
